channel.title: Drawings on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Drawings on My New Hugo Site

item.title: A Beautiful Woman
item.description: I don’t know why, but I liked the eyes-only version more. Linked below is the work-in-progress sketch:

item.title: Martin Freeman
item.description: I used to be obsessed with Sherlock (the HBO show) during the time it aired, and part of my fascination was with Martin Freeman here, who so brilliantly played the role of Watson.

item.title: Einstein
item.description: I have a particular affinity towards this sketch as I was very apprehensive about attempting Einstein, his face had much more complexity than what I usually dealt with, but it turned out good enough in the end.

item.title: Mother Teresa
item.description: Completely botched this drawing, but it reminds me of the drawing streak I used to have back when I was in my hometown during college vacations.

item.title: Charlie Chaplin (um... not quite)
item.description: I was either on acid or I had watched a sad movie before attempting this piece. A strange juxtaposition of Chaplin and Hitler.

item.title: Gandhi
item.description: My first attempt at drawing after dabbling in caricature pieces in my childhood :)
